alert.note: Alert for Bottineau; McHenry; Pierce; Rolette (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 08 at 2:10PM CST until January 09 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Bottineau, McHenry, Pierce and Rolette Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until Noon CST Sunday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Through today expect widespread blowing and drifting snow with near blizzard conditions at times in open country, from around the Turtle Mountains into the northern James River Valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Life threatening wind chills through Sunday morning could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Keep pets indoors as much as possible.
